articles.title: India plans ₹2,000-cr MSME tech upgrade to enhance exports, efficiency
articles.description: The technology upgradation scheme, proposed by the Union ministry of micro, small, and medium enterprises, and currently under discussion, will cover MSMEs with annual turnover of less than ₹50 crore, offering them a 20% capital subsidy.
articles.content: The technology upgradation scheme, proposed by the Union ministry of micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSME), and currently under discussion, will cover MSMEs with annual turnover of less than ₹50 crore, offering them a 20% capital subsidy for pu... [5521 chars]

articles.title: Americans Are Watching Fewer New TV Shows and More Free TV
articles.description: When it comes to entertainment, we live in an era of asymmetrical information. Technology companies are sitting on more data than they know how to use, and yet the average person or business partner has access to very little of it.
articles.content:
(Bloomberg) -- When it comes to entertainment, we live in an era of asymmetrical information. Technology companies are sitting on more data than they know how to use, and yet the average person or business partner has access to very little of it.
Tal... [10885 chars]

articles.title: 2025: The Turning Point in India's Technological Self-Determination
articles.description: The year 2025 marked a defining inflection point in India’s scientific and technological journey, as the nation emerged with renewed confidence and global stature across frontier domains. It signals a fundamental reorientation in India’s relationship with technology itself. From artificial intelligence and semiconductors to space exploration, nuclear energy and critical minerals, India demonstrated that it is no longer merely adopting global technologies but shaping them. For the first time in India’s independent history, technological self-determination is not a dream but […]
articles.content: The year 2025 marked a defining inflection point in India’s scientific and technological journey, as the nation emerged with renewed confidence and global stature across frontier domains. It signals a fundamental reorientation in India’s relationship... [9929 chars]

articles.description: Pune: Industrialist Gautam Adani on Sunday said that AI (artificial intelligence) is no longer just a technology race, it is a contest for global domi.

articles.title: How a Chinese start-up is scaling 3D printing from sneakers to robots
articles.description: Materials expert Wang Wenbin founded PollyPolymer in 2017 and developed a mature 3D-printing technology for footwear two years later.

articles.title: SHANTI Bill one of Modi Govt’s biggest science reforms: Dr Jitendra
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Dec 28: SHANTI Bill will go down in history as one of the Modi Government’s biggest science reforms, said Union Minister Science & Technology, Dr Jitendra Singh in a media interview here today. The Minister observed that while parliamentary discourse on reforms has traditionally focused on public welfare schemes and governance measures, the long-term socio-economic character of the nation will increasingly be shaped by reforms in science and technology. The third term of Prime Minister Narendra […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Dec 28: SHANTI Bill will go down in history as one of the Modi Government’s biggest science reforms, said Union Minister Science & Technology, Dr Jitendra Singh in a media interview here today.
The Minister observed... [4241 chars]

articles.title: Satish holds public outreach programme, reviews development works, public issues
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Dec 28: Minister for Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs (FCS&CA), Information Technology, Transport, Youth Services & Sports, Science & Technology and ARI & Trainings, Satish Sharma, today conducted an extensive public outreach programme in Chowki Choura block. The Minister was accompanied by the concerned sectoral officers of various departments. The visit was aimed at assessing the development works besides reviewing implementation of welfare schemes and interacting with the people at the grassroots level. Satish Sharma held […]

articles.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat calls upon Hindus to make India 'vishwa guru' for welfare of world
articles.description: HYDERABAD, Dec 28 : RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday called upon Hindus to work towards making the Hindu society and India a ‘Vishwa Guru’ for the welfare of the world.   Addressing the valedictory function of Vishwa Sangh Shibir, a congregation of international Hindu organisations, he said Hindus and Swayamsevaks have to lead by example and demonstrate how human intellect can be directed towards global welfare. “… Technology will advance. Social media will grow. AI will come. Everything will […]
articles.content:
HYDERABAD, Dec 28 : RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday called upon Hindus to work towards making the Hindu society and India a ‘Vishwa Guru’ for the welfare of the world.
Addressing the valedictory function of Vishwa Sangh Shibir, a congregation of in... [618 chars]

articles.title: Tirumala : AI technology used first time for pilgrim safety and crowd management : TTD Addl EO
articles.description: TIRUMALA, Dec 28: TTD Additional Executive Officer Ch. Venkaiah Chowdary on Sunday stated that everyone should work with dedication as a team to ensure that the pilgrims visiting the Tirumala Srivari Temple from December 30 to January 08 for the prestigious Vaikuntha Dwara Darshan, experience a truly divine and fulfilling darshan of the Sri Venkateshwara. Chowdary stated that state-of-the-art AI technology is used for the first time in view of pilgrim safety and crowd management. Through this technology, real-time monitoring […]
articles.content: TIRUMALA, Dec 28: TTD Additional Executive Officer Ch. Venkaiah Chowdary on Sunday stated that everyone should work with dedication as a team to ensure that the pilgrims visiting the Tirumala Srivari Temple from December 30 to January 08 for the pres... [1396 chars]

articles.title: Hospitals are using AI to slash A&E wait times
articles.description: About 50 organisations in the National Health Service have adopted the technology.
articles.content:
Hospitals are using artificial intelligence to slash wait times in emergency departments this winter.
The technology pinpoints when Accident and Emergency (A&E) demand will be high, allowing hospitals to better plan for shifts and bed space.
About 50... [2763 chars]
